availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John T. Bolinger (Graves County, KY, merchant)

body.p: Mayfield, Graves County, Kentucky, merchant. Virginia native. Married to Martha E. Halliburton Bolinger in Sumner County, Tennessee, on May 3, 1858. Father of Effie Bolinger, Lena S. Bolinger, and Johnnie Bolinger. Tailor in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Graves County in 1860. Merchant in Graves County in 1863. Charged with working with General Eleazer A. Paine to extort citizens in and around Paducah, Kentucky in July and August 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 1, p. 423B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 341.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 214B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Graves County, KY, June 1863, p. 2.
“Investigation of General Paine’s Administration at Paducah,” Louisville Weekly Journal, 4 October 1864.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Sumner County, 1854 Jun-1895 Jan: Marriages, p. 83.
"John T Bolinger (1825-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial 145408255, accessed December 27, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/145408255.
